Name: Education Management
Documentation: Encompasses all core activities related to the design, delivery, and administration of educational programs for students.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: Encompasses all core activities related to the ideation, funding, execution, and dissemination of scholarly research.

Name: Curriculum & Program Development
Documentation: The capability to design, develop, and maintain the portfolio of academic programs and their constituent courses.

Name: Research Dissemination & Impact
Documentation: The capability to share research findings with the academic community and society, and to manage and commercialize intellectual assets.

Name: Research Execution & Conduct
Documentation: The capability to plan and perform scholarly research in accordance with rigorous academic and ethical standards.

Name: Research Funding Acquisition
Documentation: The capability to identify, apply for, and secure external funding for research projects through grants and contracts.

Name: Research Strategy & Portfolio Management
Documentation: The capability to define strategic research directions, identify areas of focus, and manage the overall portfolio of research initiatives.

Name: Student Progression & Graduation
Documentation: The capability to manage student academic records, track progress toward degree completion, and confer credentials.

Name: Student Recruitment & Admissions
Documentation: The capability to attract, evaluate, and admit qualified students into academic programs.

Name: Teaching & Learning Delivery
Documentation: The capability to deliver instruction, assess student learning, and provide academic support and advising.

Name: Admissions Decision Management
Documentation: The capability to make and communicate final admissions decisions based on established criteria.

Name: Application Processing & Evaluation
Documentation: The capability to process incoming student applications and evaluate them against program-specific requirements.

Name: Course Design & Development
Documentation: The capability to define learning outcomes, structure, and content for individual courses within an academic program.

Name: Degree Auditing & Conferral
Documentation: The capability to verify that a student has met all academic requirements and to formally award the degree credential.

Name: Grant Proposal Development
Documentation: The capability to write and assemble compelling research proposals that meet the requirements of funding agencies.

Name: Instructional Delivery
Documentation: The capability to deliver course content and facilitate learning experiences through various modalities (e.g., lectures, labs, online).

Name: Intellectual Property Management
Documentation: The capability to identify, protect, and manage intellectual property (e.g., patents, copyrights) arising from research.

Name: Program Portfolio Management
Documentation: The capability to analyze market and societal needs to define and manage the university's portfolio of academic degree programs.

Name: Research Area Identification
Documentation: The capability to identify and prioritize strategic areas for research investment and faculty development.

Name: Research Contract Negotiation
Documentation: The capability to negotiate the terms, conditions, and budgets for research grants and sponsored projects.

Name: Research Project Planning
Documentation: The capability to define the scope, methodology, resources, and timeline for a specific research project.

Name: Student Assessment & Grading
Documentation: The capability to design and administer assessments (e.g., exams, papers) to measure student learning and assign grades.

Name: Scholarly Inquiry & Analysis
Documentation: The capability to conduct systematic investigation, collect and analyze data, and generate novel insights or conclusions.

Name: Strategic Partnership Development
Documentation: The capability to establish and maintain collaborative relationships with other research institutions, industry, and government agencies.

Name: Scholarly Publication Management
Documentation: The capability to prepare, submit, and manage the publication of research findings in peer-reviewed journals and books.

Name: Student Record Management
Documentation: The capability to maintain the official academic record of a student's coursework, grades, and status.

Name: Knowledge Asset
Documentation: Represents the core intellectual capital created and managed by the university, including both research and educational outputs.

Name: Stakeholder Engagement
Documentation: Represents the formal agreements, records, and relationships with key external stakeholders like students and funding bodies.

Name: Educational Asset
Documentation: Represents the structured products and records related to the university's educational offerings.

Name: Research Asset
Documentation: Represents the tangible and intangible outputs generated through the process of scholarly research.

Name: Research Agreement
Documentation: Represents a formal, legally binding agreement that governs a research-related activity.

Name: Student Record
Documentation: Represents the official and comprehensive record of a student's relationship and academic journey with the university.

Name: Academic Program
Documentation: A structured curriculum of study leading to a specific degree or credential.

Name: Academic Performance Record
Documentation: The official record of a student's grades and academic standing for a given term or course.

Name: Course Curriculum
Documentation: The detailed plan for a single academic course, including topics, learning outcomes, and assessment methods.

Name: Degree Credential
Documentation: The official diploma or certificate awarded to a student upon successful completion of an academic program.

Name: Grant Agreement
Documentation: A formal contract with a funding body that specifies the terms and deliverables for a research grant.

Name: Intellectual Property
Documentation: An intangible asset resulting from research, such as a patentable invention, discovery, or creative work.

Name: Research Data
Documentation: The raw or processed data collected or generated during the course of a research project.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body outlining a proposed research project and its budget.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: The complete set of documents and data submitted by a prospective student seeking admission.

Name: Scholarly Publication
Documentation: A formal written work, such as a journal article or book chapter, that disseminates research findings.

Name: Student Transcript
Documentation: The cumulative, official record of a student's coursework, grades, and awarded degrees.

Name: Technology License Agreement
Documentation: A contract granting a third party rights to use university-owned intellectual property in exchange for royalties or fees.

Name: Build Research Capacity
Documentation: The process of developing the faculty, infrastructure, and strategic direction to enable world-class research.

Name: Develop Academic Offering
Documentation: The process of designing and establishing degree programs and curricula available for student enrollment.

Name: Deliver Education
Documentation: The end-to-end process of recruiting, educating, and graduating a student within a specific academic program.

Name: Execute Research Project
Documentation: The end-to-end process from securing funding to delivering novel research outcomes for a specific sponsor.

Name: Define Research Strategy
Documentation: The stage of identifying and prioritizing strategic areas of research focus for the institution.

Name: Establish Research Infrastructure
Documentation: The stage of developing the partnerships, collaborations, and resources necessary to support strategic research areas.

Name: Foster Research Culture
Documentation: The stage of promoting and sustaining a vibrant research environment through portfolio management and communication.

Name: Analyze Needs
Documentation: The stage of assessing market, societal, and academic needs to identify opportunities for new or revised academic programs.

Name: Design Program
Documentation: The stage of defining the curriculum, learning outcomes, and resource requirements for a new academic program.

Name: Approve & Implement Program
Documentation: The stage of securing formal approval for a new program and making it available for enrollment.

Name: Recruit & Admit Student
Documentation: The stage of engaging with prospective students, processing applications, and making admissions offers.

Name: Educate & Assess
Documentation: The stage where the student undertakes coursework, receives instruction, and their learning is formally assessed.

Name: Advise & Support
Documentation: The stage of providing ongoing academic guidance and support to ensure student success and progression.

Name: Graduate & Confer Degree
Documentation: The stage of verifying degree completion, processing graduation, and formally conferring the academic credential.

Name: Acquire Funding
Documentation: The stage of identifying a funding opportunity, preparing a proposal, and securing a grant or contract.

Name: Plan Project
Documentation: The stage of developing a detailed research plan, including methodology, timeline, and resource allocation.

Name: Conduct Research
Documentation: The stage of executing the research plan, collecting and analyzing data, and drawing scholarly conclusions.

Name: Disseminate Results
Documentation: The stage of communicating research findings through publications and presentations, and managing resulting intellectual property.
